page.title: 17Breakdancing in Buntingford
page.content: The fashion for breakdancing came from America a few years ago and has become popular in the Buntingford area as in most other parts of the country. Breakdancing contains elements from several older kinds of dance, including tribal dances and Cossack dancing. Mostly the boys do breakdancing, although some girls also enjoy it. Breakdancing is a kind of display and is quite aggressive. Rival dancers and groups will hold a "Burn", dancing in turn and then challenging the next person to do better. Dancers are usually smartly dressed and a sort of uniform has developed. Most boys from the age of about 12 follow a group of "breakers". There is strong rivalry between groups and within them. Steven Binge
